Reviews.Title: “tiny comfortable room for a good price”
Reviews.Author: bigbobadams
Reviews.Content: Oporto fulfills its purpose of a hostel. Low cost and no frills. It was a great location and we could walk to just about all the sites in Madrid. It was a bit difficult finding its location when we first arrived on the metro, but thankfully some locals helped us find it. Our room had a tiny bathroom with a tiny bathtub shower combo, but it got the job done. No breakfast, but some tasty cafes nearby. The staff didn't speak much English, so we had some funny encounters like trying to get them to help us turn on the fan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice people and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Modi79
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised when I saw what room we had for a bit more than 50 eur, especially in the center and close to the metro. We took the metro pass but didn't use it as the hostal is within walking distance of the main touristic places : Prado, Pl. Puerta del Sol, Gran Via, Thyssen Museum, Museum Reina Sofia... All this can be reached within 30 min walk. The people at the hostal is very friendly and smiley and they are always available for any question and will always give you advice for whatever you need. Rooms are basic and clean. We had private bathroom, a big bed and a closet, no need for more. The only problem is we had a double room (couple), it was a big bed but with 2 "one-person-mattresses, maybe add a note if you want a big mattress. I would definitely recommend this hostal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: L0lal0la
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time in this small hostal. It is in a great position right in the city center and within walking distance from museums and main attractions. Staff was lovely and very helpful and the room really clean. The bathroom was a bit small but the shower absolutely great. Perfect if you are staying for a few days and do not plan to spend lots of time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hostel”
Reviews.Author: GingerSD
Reviews.Content: The rooms are basic, we had a room with 2 individual beds, and one full size bed. Perfect for my family of 4. The hostel is very close to the Prado, and to the bus stop that takes you to the airport. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: modrakocka
Reviews.Content: We were really pleasantly surprised by our stay at Hostal Oporto. This small, family run place is within walking distance of the Prado, the Parque del Retiro, and the buzzing shopping area of Puerto del Sol. The metro is a short walk away so all other attractions are easily accessible. Our room was big, quiet, air-conditioned, and the beds are very comfortable. For the price, it's outstanding value. Our positive experience could have been partly gratitude, since we'd just spent 4 nights in Barcelona in one very uncomfortable hotel, but even without that comparison, we'd be very happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean rooms,”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryCrisdean
Reviews.Content: The Good: The Hostal Oporto has one of the best locations I have ever seen in a big city. Its located across the street from the parliament buildings, which are only 4 blocks from Puerto del Sol. About as safe and secure as possible. there is a police presence 24/7. The rooms are a decent size and are cleaned every day. The hostess, M. Antoinetta, is very accommodating. It has free WiFi. The Bad: Worst beds ever. do what ever you can to avoid the double beds. The walls are tissue paper. You can hear a pin drop down the hall. The pipes are loud as hell. Meaning that you are able to hear bowel movements and showers for everybody above and around you. Conclusion: As long as you are leaving early and sleeping late, you should have no problems. The location and value are incredible. Its hands down the most secure and safe location I have ever seen. right in the heart of downtown Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “No limits fun for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: marianarrs
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best quality/price ratio hotel I have ever stayed. The rooms are very simple (as expected for this kind of hostels) but very very clean, including the small bathroom. The location couldn't be better: you are n the city's heart - walk to the main museums during the day and to the craziest bars during the night! If you are not totally sure what to do, then just ask to the friendly staff or look up Madrid's online agenda with the free unlimited WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: AliJum
Reviews.Content: Just a short stroll to the Prado and the metro. The Sevilla metro was closed for repair, but Sol is just a few extra minutes to walk. Th room is rather small and dark but as we only used it for sleeping it wasnt a big deal. The ensuite bathroom is adequate and everything is clean and well maintained. A safe is provided, but it costs 1 Euro each time you need to access it. Not a big deal for us either as we just left passports and unneeded cash. Free WIFI available. Maria Antoinette is very friendly and helpful and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hostal.

Reviews.Title: “for the price great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: rojojaal
Reviews.Content: have just got back from 4 nights in the Oporto. it is a brilliant hotel for the price. its location is difficult to beat. easy walking to most things and 5 mins to metro seville. the hotel is very clean. the staff were very friendly and helpful. the rooms are not large but if thats what you want in the centre of madrid you will pay more. that said for us we only slept in them and showered and changed they were fine. the showers were good even if the shower room was small and cramped. all in all if your looking for a budget hotel in the middle of madrid then chances are you will find it difficult to better this.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: Synne9
Reviews.Content: A convenient, central, no-frills stay in Madrid--a quick walk to the Sol plaza and metro stop, just steps to the Thyssen-B, and easily walkable to everywhere else in central Madrid. Felt very safe in the area, Wi-Fi worked great, and staff were courteous and efficient. I asked for a quieter room and got one in the back--no street noise to speak of but a little noise from neighboring rooms.The room and bathroom were basic and small, but kept quite clean. The water pressure and hot water were great, but the shower itself was a very small--a little raised square dais with shower curtain on two sides--really hard to keep water from getting all over the bathroom even for a petite female.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, central, and cheap”
Reviews.Author: NC-Traveler-47
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hostal Oporto maybe four times over a dozen years, and have always been very pleased. The staff is warm and friendly. The simple rooms have hot showers, large comfortable beds, and strong wifi. The neighborhood is quiet but central: just a block from the Paseo del Prado and Museo Thyssen but tucked away on a sidestreet that gets little noise. For those who want nightlife, the Chueca district is a 10-minute walk (but Hostal Oporto is in a more comfortable neighborhood than Chueca). And the price, 35 euros for a single, cannot be beat. There's even a vegetarian restaurant right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Oportunity Nevertheless”
Reviews.Author: AngelCrow
Reviews.Content: I had a very up-and-about four-night stay in Madrid at Hostal Oporto, and the hotel didn’t get at all in the way of me and my enjoyment. First of all, the hotel is located almost in the core of the city’s heart right behind the Thyssen Museum, with its quiet street accessing two of the most major roads in the area. You can’t beat this easily – being right in the centre but not near central traffic mess. The hotel, though it doesn’t match in “perfection” with its location, nevertheless its whole deal is still pretty unbeatable too. The – circa 1940 and even backwards – entrance hall strikes you with a little bit creepy feeling – not the best welcome. The staff is not that knowledgeable of the ways around but they provide any assistance they can, they smile and they keep the room very tidy. The room itself had no view and it was as small as anyone can expect from a two-star hotel, but it was clean, always warm and the large double bed for single use, as well as the whole rouge décor of the room, made up for that. The amenities were minimum – better bring yours – but the shower was more than satisfying for such a hotel – perhaps the best curtain-shower system I’ve seen for ages – and the water was always hot. More surprisingly good additions were the ample number of jacks for recharging my devices, the choice of having a safe-box and most of all the free wireless internet access – without needing a new password every 24h. Apart from the details mentioned above, the only thing that could have interfered with any guest’s peace of mind, is the almost non-existent room noise insulation from the noisy wooden floor of the corridor outside and the old heavy doors of the main entrance, but I am a heavy sleeper – especially after the unstoppable everyday touring of the city – so this lack didn’t bother me much. All around, a very good deal for less than 40 euro, a good homing-base for just resting, refreshing and planning your next step into this stunningly beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Frommers was right”
Reviews.Author: tskal
Reviews.Content: If you're traveling by yourself and don't want to splurge on lodging during your trip to Madrid, I recommend this well located and clean hostal. The two fellows that man the small front office are both cordial and speak good English. I stayed at Oporto for a week--two nights in the small single room w/ twin size bed and the other five nights in the larger single room with the larger bed. Both rooms were clean and serviced nicely each day. Both had TVs with just Spanish channels. Location is real convenient to Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, the Rastro, the Prado---all of Centro Madrid. Another great thing for saving money in Madrid--take the Metro from Barajas to the Centro; why pay for a taxicab?

Reviews.Title: “poorly received”
Reviews.Author: HOLAsenor
Reviews.Content: the walls are too thin, you can hear your neighbor talk at any hour otherwise not bad

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Marc-Gal
Reviews.Content: In October 2006, my wife and I stayed at Hostal Oporto for three nights due to Frommer’s review. Great location. The hostal is near to the city's major tourist attractions. There is no lift, but it’s not problem because the hostal is on the first floor (two flights). Our double room (number 11) with toilet and shower, for 55 EUR per night, had a good size and it was clean. Our room had ceiling fan and a good shower. The towels were always refreshed. Friendly welcome and an accommodating staff. Maria Isabel worked at the reception desk; she was an excellent example about this. She was very polite, thoughtful and professional. Near to the hostal, there is a great italian restaurant – Pasta Nostra Pizza Nostra, Jovellanos, 5 Street .

Reviews.Title: “Nope!”
Reviews.Author: Broadens_the_mind
Reviews.Content: Paid EUR 55 for 1 night 1 person, booked thru Venere. Great location, room a decent size, clean, secure and as an added bonus, free wi-fi. Apart from a good night's sleep that's all I care about. Five stars so far. And that's the problem. The walls of my room were so paper-thin that when my neighbours in the next room came home at umpteen o'clock (as people do, especially in Madrid), I could hear their conversation. Even with my ear plugs in, they kept me awake. A bad night's sleep means I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “very nice. cute and clean”
Reviews.Author: sufuk
Reviews.Content: It was one of the best hostel I ve ever stayed. The clean room was extremely efficient with air condition and bathroom. Also ıt was very close the city center. And the staff were cheerful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: reerehtse
Reviews.Content: The hostal is located near the Bank of Espana and near the Congress, and there is always police around, so it feels very safe. The location is convenient; 5 mins to the Thyssen-Bonamisza. The rooms are not equipped with air-con, but it's okay because September is not a hot month in Madrid. The ceiling fan may be a bit dirty though, as I kept sneezing after turning it on. The room is small, with minimal amenities, but this is hostal, so it's okay. The toilet is BAD though; there's some drainage problem definitely, as the water in the shower don't go for ages, meaning you may have to soak your feet in the water when having a shower. @__@ Hostal staff speak MINIMAL English, which can be a real problem. They don't even understand the word "receipt".

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Pleasant Hostal”
Reviews.Author: Dulcinella
Reviews.Content: It's amazing how quiet this place is, given how close to the Puerta del Sol it is. The location is amazing: up the street from the Thyssen-Bornemissa, and within spitting distance of the Prado (and an easy walk to the Plaza Mayor and Plaza Santa Ana, etc.) The previous post characterized it quite well, but I'd like to emphasize the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. They have a website: -----

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: halfstring
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Hostal Oporto for three nights. As mentioned in the Frommer's review, our room was clean and spacious for two people. The room had tall ceilings and a small closet for clothes and shoes. We had a double room (two twin beds pushed together) with a fan. Because of the hostal's location away from Puerto Del Sol, it was very quiet. The older gentleman working the reception office was really accommodating, friendly, and spoke some English. The bathroom was a little small and smelled stinky so keep the door closed during your stay. I don't think the bathroom was cleaned during our stay, just the towels were refreshed. The hostal building is being renovated so look for the scaffolding surrounding the entrance. If you're looking for a basic, affordable, and quiet place to stay that's walking distance to downtown, Hostal Oporto is it. There's a great Italian restaurant down the street, turn left - Pasta Nostra. A decent vegetarian place is also next door; look for the red tomato lights above. A small market is a few doors down, where you can stock up on water and snacks. (rating: 3.5)
